name: Floyd
summary: Designs and manufactures adaptable furniture for modern living.
verdict: Parts are sourced from the US and globally, with primary manufacturing and assembly in the United States.

name: Herman Miller
summary: Iconic American company famous for high-performance office chairs.
verdict: Vast majority of products for the North American market are manufactured in Michigan.

name: Room & Board
summary: Retailer of modern furniture. Over 90% manufactured in the US.
verdict: Strong commitment to American manufacturing, partnering with numerous domestic workshops.

name: La-Z-Boy
summary: Famous for inventing the recliner, a household name for comfort.
verdict: Operates several manufacturing plants in the US but sources components both domestically and globally.

name: Polywood
summary: Creates durable, all-weather outdoor furniture from recycled plastics.
verdict: A clear example of 'Made in USA.' The entire process happens in their US facilities.

name: Vaughan-Bassett
summary: The largest manufacturer of wooden adult bedroom furniture in the US.
verdict: Employs hundreds in its Virginia plants, using timber from the American Southeast.

name: IKEA
summary: Swedish multinational that sells ready-to-assemble furniture.
verdict: Products are sourced from a massive global supply chain. Not a 'Made in USA' brand.

name: West Elm
summary: A brand focused on modern design. Part of the Williams-Sonoma portfolio.
verdict: Owned by a US company. A significant portion of their main product line is manufactured overseas.

name: Steelcase
summary: A leading manufacturer of office furniture and architectural products.
verdict: With a large manufacturing footprint in the US, particularly in Michigan, Steelcase is a prime example of American manufacturing.

name: Ashley Furniture
summary: One of the largest furniture manufacturers in the world.
verdict: Operates a global supply chain with many products and components imported from countries like China and Vietnam.

name: Fiesta Tableware
summary: Iconic, colorful, and durable ceramic dinnerware since 1936.
verdict: Fiesta dinnerware is 100% made in the USA at the Homer Laughlin China Company's plant in Newell, West Virginia.

name: American Giant
summary: High-quality, durable clothing famous for their heavyweight hoodies.
verdict: Committed to US manufacturing, with cotton grown and sewn in the Carolinas, and all production within the United States.

name: Estwing
summary: A leading American manufacturer of hammers, axes, and specialty tools.
verdict: Estwing tools are proudly manufactured in Rockford, Illinois, as they have been since 1923.

name: Darn Tough Vermont
summary: Family-owned company making premium performance socks.
verdict: All socks are designed, tested, and manufactured in Northfield, Vermont, embodying a strong commitment to local production.

name: L.L.Bean
summary: Iconic retailer of outdoor gear, famous for its Bean Boots.
verdict: While many products are globally sourced, L.L.Bean maintains a significant US manufacturing presence, particularly at its Brunswick, Maine facility.

name: New Balance (Made in USA)
summary: Major athletic footwear brand with a dedicated line of US-made sneakers.
verdict: New Balance is unique among major sneaker brands for its commitment to domestic manufacturing for its 'Made in USA' collection.

name: Wiffle Ball, Inc.
summary: The iconic plastic ball and bat, a staple of backyard fun.
verdict: A true American classic, every Wiffle Ball and bat is produced at their single factory in Shelton, Connecticut.

name: Peterboro Basket Company
summary: One of the oldest basket manufacturers in the US, handcrafting high-quality baskets.
verdict: All baskets are handcrafted from American-grown Appalachian White Ash wood in their Peterborough, New Hampshire facility.

name: Alex and Ani
summary: Known for its expandable charm bracelets, jewelry, and accessories.
verdict: The company proudly states that its jewelry is designed and crafted in Rhode Island, supporting local artisans.

name: Timberland
summary: Globally recognized brand for rugged outdoor boots and apparel.
verdict: While headquartered in the US, the vast majority of Timberland's manufacturing now occurs overseas. Some specialized lines may have US assembly.

name: Origin Maine
summary: Manufactures functional and durable goods from jeans to supplements.
verdict: A model of vertical integration, Origin Maine controls its entire supply chain from its Maine-based factory.

name: Vermont Flannel Company
summary: Specializes in soft, high-quality flannel clothing.
verdict: All products are handcrafted and sewn in the USA, with a strong connection to their home state of Vermont.

name: New England Shirt Company
summary: Creates ready-to-wear and custom shirts in a historic MA factory.
verdict: As America's oldest ready-to-wear shirt manufacturer, every shirt is cut and sewn in their Fall River, MA factory.

name: All American Clothing Co.
summary: Offers a wide range of clothing, from jeans to outerwear.
verdict: A strong advocate for domestic manufacturing, tracing materials and labor to ensure every product meets their 'All American' standard.

name: Gitman Bros.
summary: A heritage brand known for its impeccably crafted men's dress shirts.
verdict: Remaining one of the few American shirtmakers, Gitman Bros. continues to produce all its shirts in its Ashland, Pennsylvania factory.

name: Bondhus
summary: Leading manufacturer of high-quality Allen wrenches and hex tools.
verdict: All tools are produced in their Monticello, Minnesota facility, maintaining a strong commitment to American manufacturing.

name: Wilde Tool
summary: A full line of professional-grade hand tools including pliers, screwdrivers, and pry bars.
verdict: Wilde Tool is proud to manufacture all of its products in Hiawatha, Kansas, since its founding.

name: Wright Tool
summary: Manufactures a broad line of high-quality, heavy-duty hand tools for the industrial market.
verdict: All Wright tools are designed and manufactured in Barberton, Ohio, with a focus on American steel and labor.

name: Tekton
summary: A new-era tool company actively increasing its US production of pliers, drivers, and wrenches.
verdict: Tekton is praised for its transparency and for bringing more manufacturing back to the US, though some components are still globally sourced.

name: Klein Tools
summary: A dominant brand for electricians, offering a wide range of hand tools and equipment.
verdict: While historically a US-made brand, Klein now operates a global supply chain. Many of their core products are still made in US factories, but others are sourced from overseas.

name: Marshalltown
summary: Premier tool manufacturer for construction, especially masonry and drywall.
verdict: Marshalltown has been manufacturing tools in Marshalltown, Iowa for over a century and remains a top name in the industry.

name: Lucchese Bootmaker
summary: Legendary Texas-based company crafting high-end western boots since 1883.
verdict: Lucchese boots are handmade in El Paso, Texas, representing the pinnacle of American bootmaking craftsmanship.

name: Mystery Ranch
summary: Builds high-quality, durable backpacks for military, firefighting, and mountaineering use.
verdict: While they have international production, their high-end packs and custom work are still proudly built in Bozeman, Montana.

name: Oomingmak
summary: A cooperative of Native Alaskan women who hand-knit garments from Qiviut, the soft under-wool of the musk ox.
verdict: A truly unique Alaskan enterprise, supporting native craftspeople and traditions. All items are hand-knitted by members across Alaska.

name: Boll & Branch
summary: Sells luxury bedding, sheets, and towels made from organic cotton with a transparent supply chain.
verdict: While raw materials are sourced globally, Boll & Branch is a US-owned company with a strong commitment to ethical production.

name: West Paw
summary: Creates eco-friendly and durable dog toys, beds, and treats with a focus on sustainability.
verdict: All West Paw products are proudly manufactured in Bozeman, Montana. They are a certified B Corp.

name: Good To-Go
summary: Gourmet dehydrated meals for outdoor adventures, cooked and packaged in Maine.
verdict: All meals are handmade and packaged in Kittery, Maine, offering a high-quality American-made option for adventurers.

name: Liberty Graphics
summary: An environmentally conscious company that prints nature-inspired t-shirts using water-based inks.
verdict: All printing is done in their facility in Liberty, Maine, upholding a long tradition of local, eco-friendly production.

name: Brant & Cochran
summary: Reviving the art of American axe making, forging high-quality axes by hand.
verdict: Brant & Cochran is dedicated to rebuilding the Maine axe-making tradition, with all forging and finishing done in their South Portland workshop.

name: Rancourt & Co.
summary: Family-owned company crafting handmade leather shoes and moccasins for generations.
verdict: A testament to enduring craftsmanship, every pair of Rancourt & Co. shoes is meticulously handcrafted in their Lewiston, Maine factory.

name: Quoddy
summary: Creates custom, made-to-order moccasins, shoes, and boots with exceptional materials and craftsmanship.
verdict: Quoddy embodies Maine's footwear legacy, with each pair being handmade by a single craftsman in their Lewiston, Maine workshop.

name: Fox Family Chips
summary: A family-owned business making small-batch potato chips from locally grown Maine potatoes.
verdict: A true farm-to-table product, the potatoes are grown and the chips are made by the Fox family in Mapleton, Maine.

name: Easymoc
summary: Handsewn, comfortable moccasins and footwear designed for everyday wear.
verdict: Every pair of Easymocs is handcrafted by artisans in Lewiston, Maine, a historic hub for American shoemaking.

name: Flowfold
summary: Manufactures minimalist, lightweight, and durable wallets, bags, and backpacks.
verdict: All Flowfold products are designed and manufactured in their Gorham, Maine facility, backed by a lifetime warranty.

name: Turtle Fur
summary: A Vermont-based company known for its warm and comfortable fleece neck warmers, hats, and accessories.
verdict: While many products are made globally, Turtle Fur maintains its roots and some production in Morrisville, Vermont.

name: Johnson Woolen Mills
summary: A legendary family-owned company that has produced classic wool outerwear since 1842.
verdict: An icon of Vermont industry, their rugged wool garments are still cut and sewn in their factory in Johnson, Vermont.

name: Burgeon Outdoor
summary: Outdoor apparel and gear designed and manufactured in the White Mountains.
verdict: Burgeon is committed to revitalizing local manufacturing, with all products made in their Lincoln, New Hampshire workshop.

name: Bailey Works
summary: Creator of professional-grade, custom messenger bags and totes.
verdict: Each bag is built to order in their Newmarket, New Hampshire workshop, continuing a long tradition of New England soft-good manufacturing.

name: LupinePet
summary: Offers a huge variety of colorful, durable collars, leashes, and harnesses for dogs and cats.
verdict: All LupinePet products are proudly built in the heart of the White Mountains in Conway, New Hampshire.

name: NEMO Equipment
summary: Designs innovative and award-winning tents, sleeping bags, and camping furniture.
verdict: NEMO is a US-owned company based in New Hampshire, though the bulk of its manufacturing is done overseas. They are committed to ethical production.

name: Limmer Boots
summary: Legendary, custom-made hiking boots crafted by hand in a small New Hampshire workshop.
verdict: For nearly a century, Limmer has been handcrafting some of the world's most durable hiking boots in Intervale, New Hampshire.

name: Ragged Mountain Equipment
summary: Technical outdoor clothing and gear, sewn on-site for climbing, hiking, and skiing.
verdict: All Ragged Mountain brand gear is cut and sewn in their workshop in Intervale, New Hampshire, a true local operation.

name: Stonewall Kitchen
summary: Creates a wide range of specialty foods, including jams, sauces, and baking mixes.
verdict: A New England staple, Stonewall Kitchen produces its award-winning products in York, Maine.

name: Ben & Jerry's
summary: Iconic ice cream brand known for its creative flavors and social mission.
verdict: While its primary manufacturing facilities are in Vermont, Ben & Jerry's is owned by the British conglomerate Unilever.

name: Faygo
summary: A beloved Detroit brand producing a wide variety of soda pop flavors since 1907.
verdict: Faygo is a regional icon, with its beverages still being produced in Detroit, Michigan.

name: Better Made
summary: A Detroit institution famous for its potato chips and other snack foods.
verdict: Since 1930, Better Made snacks have been manufactured in Detroit, Michigan.

name: Bertman Original Ball Park Mustard
summary: A spicy brown mustard that has been a Cleveland classic since the 1920s.
verdict: This iconic stadium mustard is proudly made in Cleveland, Ohio.

name: Polar Beverages
summary: One of the largest independent soft-drink bottlers in the US, family-owned for generations.
verdict: Polar continues to produce its famous seltzers and sodas at its facility in Worcester, Massachusetts.

name: Moxie
summary: One of the first mass-produced soft drinks in the US, known for its distinct, bittersweet flavor.
verdict: Though created in Lowell, MA, Moxie is now owned by The Coca-Cola Company and produced in various locations.

name: Teddy Peanut Butter
summary: A leading brand of all-natural peanut butter, family-owned for over 100 years.
verdict: All Teddy Peanut Butter is made in their factory in Everett, Massachusetts.

name: Grillo's Pickles
summary: Crisp, fresh pickles made with a 100-year-old family recipe, originally sold from a street cart.
verdict: Grillo's Pickles are made in Boston, Massachusetts, maintaining their commitment to fresh, simple ingredients.

name: Cape Cod Potato Chips
summary: Kettle-cooked potato chips known for their distinct crunch and flavor.
verdict: While the chips are famously made at their Hyannis, MA factory, the parent company is Campbell Soup Company.

name: Hasbro
summary: One of the largest toy makers in the world, founded and headquartered in Rhode Island.
verdict: Hasbro is a US-owned company, but like most major toy companies, its manufacturing is primarily done through a global supply chain, largely in Asia.

name: Yankee Candle
summary: The largest manufacturer of scented candles in the United States.
verdict: Yankee Candles are produced in their manufacturing facility in Whately, Massachusetts.

name: Ocean Spray
summary: A cooperative of cranberry and grapefruit growers, producing juices, sauces, and dried cranberries.
verdict: Owned by over 700 farmer families, Ocean Spray products are made from US-grown fruit in facilities across the country.

name: Maine Made
summary: A marketplace for a wide variety of goods crafted by artisans and makers across the state of Maine.
verdict: Maine Made is a state-sponsored program that promotes and supports local producers, ensuring authenticity.

name: Paul Component Engineering
summary: Manufactures high-quality, durable bicycle components known for their simple design and reliability.
verdict: All Paul Component products are designed and manufactured in their Chico, California facility.

name: Chris King Precision Components
summary: Legendary manufacturer of high-end bicycle components, especially headsets and hubs.
verdict: All products are manufactured in their Portland, Oregon facility, with a strong focus on environmental sustainability.

name: Moots
summary: Builds high-performance, handcrafted titanium bicycle frames for road, mountain, and gravel.
verdict: Every Moots bike frame is expertly handcrafted from start to finish in Steamboat Springs, Colorado.

name: Lynskey Performance
summary: A family-run company that designs and manufactures high-performance titanium bicycle frames.
verdict: All Lynskey frames are handcrafted in their facility in Chattanooga, Tennessee.

name: HED Cycling Products
summary: Pioneering manufacturer of high-performance and aerodynamic bicycle wheels.
verdict: HED wheels are proudly designed and manufactured in their facility in Roseville, Minnesota.

name: Kona Bikes
summary: An independent brand known for its durable and fun mountain bikes, gravel bikes, and commuters.
verdict: Kona is a US-owned company based in Washington state, though its frames are primarily manufactured in Asia.

name: Salsa Cycles
summary: A brand focused on adventure cycling, offering bikes for bikepacking, gravel, and trail riding.
verdict: Salsa is part of the US-based Quality Bicycle Products (QBP) portfolio, with bikes designed in Minnesota and manufactured overseas.

name: Franklin Sports
summary: A major manufacturer of sporting goods, including baseball gloves, balls, and backyard games.
verdict: A US-owned, family company based in Massachusetts. While many products are made overseas, they retain a US presence.

name: Taco Comfort Solutions
summary: Manufactures high-quality heating, cooling, and plumbing solutions like circulator pumps and valves.
verdict: Taco is a family-owned company that manufactures its products across several US facilities, including its main plant in Cranston, RI.

name: White Industries
summary: Produces beautifully machined, high-end bicycle components including hubs, cranks, and bottom brackets.
verdict: All White Industries components are designed and manufactured in-house at their Petaluma, California facility.

name: Serotta
summary: A legendary name in custom, high-performance bicycle frames, known for pioneering titanium and carbon fiber.
verdict: After a hiatus, Serotta has returned, building custom frames in Saratoga Springs, New York, continuing its legacy of American craftsmanship.

name: Gibson
summary: Iconic American instrument manufacturer, maker of the legendary Les Paul electric guitar.
verdict: Gibson guitars are proudly made in the USA, with primary production facilities in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: Lodge Cast Iron
summary: America's oldest family-owned cookware manufacturer, famous for its durable cast iron skillets.
verdict: Lodge continues to produce its cast iron cookware in its foundries in South Pittsburg, Tennessee.

name: Igloo Coolers
summary: One of the most recognized cooler brands in the world, originating in Texas.
verdict: Igloo operates a massive manufacturing facility in Katy, Texas, where the majority of its hard-sided coolers are made.

name: Leatherman
summary: The original American multi-tool manufacturer, creating high-quality tools for everyday carry and outdoor use.
verdict: All Leatherman multi-tools are engineered and manufactured in their facility in Portland, Oregon.

name: Wilson Sporting Goods
summary: A major American sports equipment brand, the official football supplier for the NFL.
verdict: While most products are made overseas, Wilson's iconic leather footballs are handmade in their Ada, Ohio factory. The parent company is Finnish.

name: Goruck
summary: Builds military-grade rucksacks and gear, with a strong emphasis on quality and community.
verdict: Goruck's core rucksacks and a growing line of apparel are built in the USA and backed by a lifetime guarantee.

name: YETI
summary: High-end outdoor brand famous for its extremely durable coolers, drinkware, and bags.
verdict: YETI is a US-owned company based in Austin, TX. While most products are manufactured overseas, some hard coolers are made in US facilities.

name: Crayola
summary: The iconic crayon and art supply company that has been a staple in classrooms for generations.
verdict: Billions of Crayola crayons are produced each year in their Easton, Pennsylvania factory. The parent company is Hallmark.

name: 3M
summary: A massive American multinational conglomerate corporation operating in the fields of industry, worker safety, U.S. health care, and consumer goods.
verdict: 3M operates numerous manufacturing plants across the United States, producing thousands of products from Post-it Notes to advanced abrasives.

name: KitchenAid
summary: Famous for its legendary stand mixers and other high-quality kitchen appliances.
verdict: The iconic KitchenAid stand mixers are proudly assembled in their factory in Greenville, Ohio.

name: Zippo
summary: Manufacturer of the world-famous reusable metal lighter, known for its lifetime guarantee.
verdict: Nearly all Zippo lighters have been produced in their Bradford, Pennsylvania factory since 1932.

name: Corningware
summary: Brand of glass-ceramic cookware and bakeware known for its ability to go from freezer to oven.
verdict: After a period of being made overseas, the classic Corningware is once again being manufactured in the USA.

name: Pyrex
summary: A household name for durable glass bakeware, measuring cups, and food storage containers.
verdict: Pyrex glassware products are made in the USA, primarily at their factory in Charleroi, Pennsylvania.

name: Weber Grills
summary: Inventor of the kettle grill and a leader in charcoal, gas, and electric outdoor grills.
verdict: While components are globally sourced, Weber's main grill lines are designed and engineered in Illinois and assembled in their US facilities.

name: Filson
summary: A heritage brand producing rugged, high-quality outerwear, bags, and luggage since 1897.
verdict: Filson continues to manufacture its signature bags and a portion of its outerwear in its Seattle, Washington factory.

name: Schott NYC
summary: Iconic American brand that created the first motorcycle jacket. Known for leather jackets and peacoats.
verdict: Schott NYC continues its legacy of American manufacturing by producing its classic leather jackets in its factory in Union, New Jersey.

name: Libman
summary: A family-owned company making high-quality brooms, mops, and other cleaning supplies for over 120 years.
verdict: The majority of Libman products, including their well-known Wonder Mop, are manufactured at their facility in Arcola, Illinois.

name: King Koil
summary: A mattress company founded in 1898, with a network of US-based manufacturing facilities.
verdict: King Koil mattresses sold in the US are made in one of their factories across the country, including their main facility in Avondale, Arizona.

name: Tervis
summary: Famous for its insulated tumblers that keep drinks hot or cold, backed by a lifetime guarantee.
verdict: All Tervis tumblers are proudly made in their factory in North Venice, Florida.

name: Vermont Teddy Bear
summary: Creates handcrafted, personalized teddy bears with a lifetime guarantee.
verdict: Every Vermont Teddy Bear is handmade at their factory in Shelburne, Vermont, a popular tourist destination.

name: Green Toys
summary: Manufactures eco-friendly toys and tableware for kids from 100% recycled plastic milk jugs.
verdict: A model of sustainable production, Green Toys are sourced, designed, and manufactured entirely within the USA, primarily in California.

name: Red Wing Heritage
summary: Iconic brand of high-quality leather work boots and shoes, worn for generations.
verdict: Red Wing's premium Heritage line continues to be handcrafted in their factory in Red Wing, Minnesota.

name: Channellock
summary: Family-owned company famous for its iconic tongue-and-groove pliers and other hand tools.
verdict: Channellock has been forging high-quality pliers in Meadville, Pennsylvania since 1886.

name: Case Knives
summary: An American manufacturer of premium, handcrafted knives that are passed down for generations.
verdict: W.R. Case & Sons Cutlery Company's knives are handmade in Bradford, Pennsylvania, a town with a rich cutlery history.

name: Louisville Slugger
summary: The official bat of Major League Baseball, an iconic brand in American sports history.
verdict: While the brand is owned by Wilson Sporting Goods (a Finnish company), Louisville Slugger's famous wooden bats are still proudly made in their Louisville, Kentucky factory and museum.

name: Okabashi Brands
summary: Family-owned company making comfortable, recyclable sandals and shoes.
verdict: A commitment to American manufacturing for over 30 years, all Okabashi footwear is made in their Buford, Georgia factory.

name: Smithey Ironware Co.
summary: Crafts premium, handcrafted cast iron and carbon steel cookware.
verdict: Smithey creates heirloom-quality cookware, designed and manufactured in their workshop in Charleston, South Carolina.

name: Diamond Brand Gear
summary: Historic outdoor gear company crafting durable tents, packs, and hiking gear.
verdict: With roots dating back to the 1880s, Diamond Brand Gear proudly sews its products in Fletcher, North Carolina, near the Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: Red Land Cotton
summary: Grows and crafts heirloom-quality cotton linens, from bedding to bath towels.
verdict: A true farm-to-home brand, the cotton is grown on their family farm and all manufacturing is done in the USA.

name: Zkano
summary: A family-owned company making organic cotton socks for men, women, and children.
verdict: Zkano socks are proudly made in small batches at their family mill in Fort Payne, Alabama.

name: Cheerwine
summary: A beloved soft drink with a unique cherry flavor, a Southern institution since 1917.
verdict: This family-owned brand has been made in Salisbury, North Carolina for over a century.

name: Mt. Olive Pickle Company
summary: One of the best-selling brands of pickles, relishes, and peppers in the United States.
verdict: Mt. Olive has been packing and processing its famous pickles in Mount Olive, North Carolina since 1926.

name: Texas Pete
summary: A famous hot sauce brand known for its mildly spicy and versatile flavor profile.
verdict: Despite its name, Texas Pete hot sauce has always been manufactured by the Garner family in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

name: MoonPie
summary: A classic American snack consisting of two round graham crackers with marshmallow filling, dipped in a flavored coating.
verdict: The iconic MoonPie has been produced by Chattanooga Bakery, Inc. in Chattanooga, Tennessee since 1917.

name: La Sportiva (Rebuilds)
summary: An Italian brand famous for climbing shoes, mountaineering boots, and trail running shoes.
verdict: While manufactured in Italy, La Sportiva operates an official US resoling and repair facility, extending the life of their products with American labor.

name: American Leather
summary: Creates custom-upholstered, premium leather and fabric furniture, known for its quick ship times.
verdict: All furniture is manufactured in their state-of-the-art factory in Dallas, Texas.

name: Buck Knives
summary: An iconic American knife manufacturer, famous for inventing the folding hunting knife.
verdict: After moving from California, Buck Knives now manufactures its core product line in Post Falls, Idaho.

name: Gibson Guitar
summary: Legendary American instrument manufacturer, maker of the Les Paul electric guitar.
verdict: Gibson's iconic electric and acoustic guitars are proudly made in their factories in Nashville, Tennessee and Bozeman, Montana.

name: Rite in the Rain
summary: Produces all-weather writing paper that sheds water and enables writing in any condition.
verdict: All Rite in the Rain paper is manufactured at their facility in Tacoma, Washington, to withstand the toughest weather.

name: Stormy Kromer
summary: Maker of the iconic wool winter cap with a distinctive earband, a Midwest legend.
verdict: Every Stormy Kromer cap is hand-stitched in their factory in Ironwood, Michigan, continuing a century-long tradition.

name: Wigwam Socks
summary: A historic brand that has been knitting high-quality socks for sports and everyday wear since 1905.
verdict: Wigwam is committed to local manufacturing and knits its socks in its hometown of Sheboygan, Wisconsin.

name: Duke Cannon Supply Co.
summary: Produces high-quality grooming goods for men, with a portion of proceeds benefiting U.S. veterans.
verdict: All Duke Cannon soap and grooming products are proudly made in the United States.

name: Anchor Hocking
summary: A leading designer and manufacturer of glassware products, from drinkware to bakeware.
verdict: The majority of Anchor Hocking's products are manufactured at their plants in Lancaster, Ohio and Monaca, Pennsylvania.

name: Calphalon
summary: A popular brand of high-quality cookware, cutlery, and bakeware.
verdict: While owned by Newell Brands, Calphalon's core cookware lines are manufactured and assembled in Toledo, Ohio.

name: Simms Fishing Products
summary: A leading manufacturer of high-performance fishing waders, outerwear, and technical apparel.
verdict: Simms is one of the few fishing apparel companies to manufacture its GORE-TEX waders in the USA, at its facility in Bozeman, Montana.

name: Allen Edmonds
summary: A premium men's footwear brand known for its classic dress shoes and Goodyear-welt construction.
verdict: Allen Edmonds continues to craft its high-end footwear at its factory in Port Washington, Wisconsin.

name: O'Keeffe's Company
summary: Produces hardworking skincare products, including their famous Working Hands hand cream.
verdict: All O'Keeffe's products are made in the USA, providing guaranteed relief for dry, cracked skin.

name: General Electric (Appliances)
summary: An iconic American brand, now producing a wide range of home appliances.
verdict: Though owned by Chinese company Haier, GE Appliances still operates massive manufacturing facilities in the US, including Appliance Park in Louisville, KY.

name: Burt's Bees
summary: A leading brand in natural personal care products, famous for its beeswax lip balm.
verdict: Originally from Maine, Burt's Bees now manufactures its products in North Carolina, but is owned by the US conglomerate Clorox.

name: The Honest Company
summary: Provides a range of baby, beauty, and cleaning products with a focus on safe, effective ingredients.
verdict: A US-based company, Honest products are sourced from a variety of locations, with an emphasis on transparency and ethical production.

name: Mud Pie
summary: Designs a wide range of giftware, home decor, and baby clothing.
verdict: Mud Pie is a US-owned company, designed in Georgia, with a global manufacturing base.

name: White Oak Pastures
summary: A family farm offering grass-fed beef, pastured poultry, and other artisanal goods.
verdict: A model of regenerative agriculture, all products are raised and processed on their farm in Bluffton, Georgia.

name: Thistle Farms
summary: A social enterprise that helps women survivors with a line of candles, body care, and home goods.
verdict: Products are handmade by women survivors in Nashville, Tennessee, directly supporting their recovery and economic freedom.

name: Holtz Leather Co.
summary: Family-owned business crafting high-quality leather goods like bags, journals, and accessories.
verdict: All products are handcrafted by a team of artisans in their workshop in Huntsville, Alabama.

name: Alabama Sawyer
summary: Designs modern furniture and home goods from fallen urban trees in the Birmingham area.
verdict: A truly local and sustainable model, all products are designed and built in their Birmingham, Alabama workshop.

name: Canebrake Soap Co.
summary: Creates small-batch, handcrafted soaps using natural ingredients.
verdict: All soaps are handmade in their workshop in Demopolis, Alabama.

name: Emily G's
summary: Award-winning producer of jams, jellies, and sauces with unique flavor combinations.
verdict: All products are made in small batches in Dunwoody, Georgia.

name: CreekKooler
summary: An innovative floating cooler designed to be pulled behind a kayak, canoe, or paddleboard.
verdict: This unique outdoor product is manufactured in the USA.

name: Orca Coolers
summary: Manufactures high-performance, durable hard-sided coolers and drinkware.
verdict: All ORCA hard-sided coolers are proudly manufactured in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: Lamons
summary: A leading manufacturer of gaskets and bolts, primarily for industrial use but with consumer applications.
verdict: With a major manufacturing presence in the Southeast, Lamons produces its goods in US facilities.

name: Lily & Lottie
summary: A women's clothing brand known for its high-quality basics and comfortable essentials.
verdict: Many of their core products are designed and produced in partnership with manufacturers in the USA.

name: Cathead Distillery
summary: The first legal distillery in Mississippi, producing award-winning vodka, gin, and bourbon.
verdict: All spirits are distilled and bottled at their facility in Jackson, Mississippi.

name: Native Creole
summary: Produces authentic, small-batch Creole seasoning blends and spices.
verdict: This family-owned business makes all of its spice blends in New Orleans, Louisiana.

name: Cajun Spoon
summary: Offers easy-to-prepare Cajun meal mixes, from jambalaya to gumbo.
verdict: All products are blended and packaged in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, delivering authentic local flavor.

name: Blue Delta Jeans
summary: Creates bespoke, custom-fit jeans for men and women.
verdict: Every pair of Blue Delta Jeans is measured, cut, and sewn in Tupelo, Mississippi.

name: Benchmade Knife Company
summary: A premier manufacturer of high-quality folding and fixed-blade knives.
verdict: All Benchmade knives are manufactured in their state-of-the-art facility in Oregon City, Oregon.

name: Tough Traveler
summary: Manufactures high-quality luggage, backpacks, and baby carriers since 1970.
verdict: 100% of Tough Traveler products are designed and manufactured in their factory in Schenectady, New York.

name: Hinkle Chair Company
summary: One of America's oldest furniture companies, famous for its classic wooden rocking chairs.
verdict: Since 1834, Hinkle chairs have been crafted in the USA, with production now centered in Greenbrier, Tennessee.

name: Flint and Tinder
summary: Huckberry's in-house brand of rugged, American-inspired menswear.
verdict: A significant portion of their collection, including their famous waxed trucker jackets, are made in the USA.

name: Makr
summary: A design studio creating high-quality leather goods, bags, and home accessories with a minimalist aesthetic.
verdict: Makr products are designed and manufactured in the USA, with their studio located near Orlando, Florida.

name: Jacobsen Salt Co.
summary: The first company to harvest salt in the Pacific Northwest since Lewis and Clark.
verdict: All salt is harvested from Netarts Bay on the Oregon Coast, providing a pure, hand-harvested American product.

name: Schoolhouse Electric
summary: Creates modern heirlooms, from lighting and hardware to furniture and bedding.
verdict: Many of their iconic lighting fixtures and clocks are assembled to order in their Portland, Oregon factory.

name: The New Primal
summary: Produces grass-fed beef jerky and meat sticks, as well as sauces and seasonings.
verdict: The New Primal is committed to high-quality ingredients and manufactures its products in the USA.

name: Lowcountry Kettle
summary: Makes kettle-cooked potato chips with Lowcountry-inspired flavors.
verdict: These small-batch chips are cooked and packaged in Charleston, South Carolina.

name: Bulls Bay Saltworks
summary: Harvests salt by hand from the pristine waters of Bulls Bay, South Carolina.
verdict: A completely local operation, the salt is harvested and solar-evaporated on their homestead in McClellanville, SC.

name: HVNLY
summary: Creates premium, handcrafted CBD and wellness products.
verdict: All products are formulated and produced in their facility in Las Vegas, Nevada.

name: Ethel M Chocolates
summary: A gourmet chocolatier founded by Forrest Mars Sr., producing preservative-free chocolates.
verdict: All Ethel M Chocolates are made in their factory and cactus garden in Henderson, Nevada.

name: Swoon
summary: A brand of sugar-free simple syrups and cocktail mixers.
verdict: Swoon's products are developed and produced in the USA, with a significant presence in Las Vegas.

name: Duluth Pack
summary: America's oldest canvas and leather bag and pack maker, offering a lifetime guarantee.
verdict: Every Duluth Pack product is handcrafted and signed by the artisan who made it in their Duluth, Minnesota factory.

name: Faribault Woolen Mill Co.
summary: A historic mill crafting high-quality wool blankets, throws, and scarves.
verdict: A rare example of a fully integrated woolen mill, all products are made from raw wool to finished good in Faribault, Minnesota.

name: Epicurean
summary: Produces durable, eco-friendly cutting boards and kitchen tools from wood fiber composite.
verdict: All Epicurean products are sustainably made in their facility in Superior, Wisconsin.

name: Scandivanian
summary: High-quality, handcrafted furniture with a focus on modern and Scandinavian designs.
verdict: All furniture is built to order by skilled craftspeople in their workshop in Des Moines, Iowa.

name: Amana Furniture & Clock Shop
summary: Handcrafts solid wood furniture and grandfather clocks in the German tradition of the Amana Colonies.
verdict: A true heritage brand, all furniture is made by hand in their workshop in Amana, Iowa.

name: Missouri Meerschaum
summary: The world's oldest and largest manufacturer of cool, sweet-smoking corncob pipes.
verdict: A true American original, every pipe has been handcrafted in Washington, Missouri since 1869.

name: Vollrath Company
summary: A leading manufacturer of professional-grade cookware and smallwares for the foodservice industry.
verdict: Vollrath produces a significant portion of its stainless steel and aluminum products in its US facilities, primarily in Wisconsin.

name: 5.11 Tactical
summary: A popular brand of tactical gear, apparel, and footwear for law enforcement, military, and public safety personnel.
verdict: While a US-based company, the majority of their products are manufactured overseas. They maintain a 'Made in the USA' collection.

name: Bully Tools
summary: Manufactures heavy-duty, commercial-grade lawn and garden tools, from shovels to rakes.
verdict: All Bully Tools products are 100% made in the USA, with a focus on durability and quality materials.

name: Council Tool
summary: Forges professional-grade hand tools, including axes, pry bars, and specialty tools for forestry and firefighting.
verdict: A family-owned business since 1886, all Council Tool products are proudly made in their factory in Lake Waccamaw, North Carolina.

name: Warwood Tool
summary: The oldest manufacturer of forged hand tools in the United States, producing hammers, sledges, and mattocks.
verdict: Since 1854, Warwood has been forging tools in Wheeling, West Virginia, continuing a long legacy of American steelwork.

name: Ekornes (Stressless)
summary: A Norwegian company famous for its Stressless line of reclining armchairs and sofas.
verdict: While the components are made in Norway, Ekornes operates a US assembly plant in Morganton, NC to serve the American market.

name: Frye Company
summary: The oldest continuously operated shoe company in the United States, known for its iconic boots.
verdict: While a large portion of their footwear is now made overseas, Frye maintains a 'Made in the USA' collection crafted in US factories.

name: Kelty
summary: A major brand for backpacks, tents, and sleeping bags, known for its quality and affordability.
verdict: Kelty is a US-owned company based in Colorado, but its products are primarily manufactured in Asia.

name: Faribault Foods
summary: A leading food processing company producing canned goods like beans, chili, and vegetables.
verdict: Faribault Foods has been producing canned goods in the Midwest for over a century, with its main plant in Faribault, Minnesota.

name: Tony Chachere's
summary: Creator of the world-famous Original Creole Seasoning and other Louisiana-inspired food products.
verdict: All of Tony Chachere's products are proudly made in Opelousas, Louisiana.

name: Black Rifle Coffee Company
summary: A veteran-owned coffee company that roasts and sells premium coffee.
verdict: BRCC is committed to hiring veterans and roasts all of its coffee at facilities in Salt Lake City, UT, and Manchester, TN.

name: Kershaw Knives
summary: A popular brand of sporting and pocket knives known for its innovative designs and patented technologies.
verdict: While owned by the Japanese KAI Group, Kershaw proudly produces a large number of its knives in its Tualatin, Oregon facility.

name: Gerber Gear
summary: An American brand that produces knives, multi-tools, and other outdoor equipment.
verdict: While owned by the Finnish company Fiskars, Gerber continues to manufacture a significant portion of its products in its Portland, Oregon factory.

name: Carhartt (Made in USA)
summary: Iconic workwear brand known for its heavy-duty jackets, bibs, and pants.
verdict: While most Carhartt products are made overseas, the company maintains a dedicated 'Made in the USA' line with products built in factories in Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: Litespeed Bicycles
summary: A pioneer in titanium bicycles, known for high-performance road and mountain bike frames.
verdict: Every Litespeed titanium frame is handcrafted at their facility in Chattanooga, Tennessee.

name: Cabela's
summary: A major retailer of hunting, fishing, camping, and outdoor recreation merchandise.
verdict: Founded in Nebraska, Cabela's is now part of Bass Pro Shops. While most branded gear is made overseas, their retail presence is a major employer in many rural areas.

name: Coleman Company
summary: An iconic brand for outdoor recreation gear, especially coolers and lanterns.
verdict: Many of Coleman's classic coolers are still manufactured at their plant in Wichita, Kansas, though many other products are globally sourced.

name: Brahmin
summary: Creates high-quality, luxury leather handbags with a timeless and elegant design.
verdict: Brahmin handbags are designed and handcrafted by artisans in their factory in Fairhaven, Massachusetts.

name: Annin Flagmakers
summary: The oldest and largest flag manufacturer in the United States, producing high-quality American flags.
verdict: All Annin flags are proudly made in their factories in Virginia and Ohio, using domestic materials.

name: Nordic Ware
summary: Inventor of the Bundt pan and a leading manufacturer of high-quality bakeware and cookware.
verdict: A family-owned company, Nordic Ware manufactures its products in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

name: Lodge Manufacturing
summary: America's oldest family-owned cookware manufacturer, famous for its durable cast iron skillets.
verdict: Lodge continues to produce its cast iron cookware in its foundries in South Pittsburg, Tennessee.

name: Topo Designs
summary: Designs classic outdoor gear and apparel with a modern, urban aesthetic.
verdict: Many of Topo Designs' iconic bags and some apparel pieces are made in Colorado, though they also utilize global manufacturing.

name: Melanzana
summary: A beloved cult brand making high-quality fleece hoodies and outdoor apparel.
verdict: A truly local operation, every single item is designed, cut, and sewn in their store in Leadville, Colorado.

name: Smartwool
summary: A leader in merino wool socks, base layers, and apparel for outdoor activities.
verdict: While owned by VF Corporation, Smartwool proudly makes the majority of its socks in partner mills located in the Southeast USA.

name: Black Diamond Equipment
summary: A global leader in climbing, skiing, and mountain sports equipment.
verdict: While most products are made overseas, Black Diamond's technical hardware like carabiners and protection are manufactured in their Salt Lake City, Utah facility.

name: Goal Zero
summary: Innovator in portable solar power, offering panels, power stations, and lighting.
verdict: A US-based company, Goal Zero products are designed in Utah and manufactured primarily in Asia.

name: Cotopaxi
summary: A B-Corp creating sustainably designed outdoor gear, known for its vibrant Del Día line made from remnant fabrics.
verdict: Cotopaxi is a US-owned company based in Salt Lake City, with a transparent global supply chain.

name: Patagonia
summary: A global leader in sustainable outdoor clothing and gear, known for its environmental activism.
verdict: While the majority of products are globally sourced, Patagonia maintains a small 'Made in USA' collection and supports US textile mills.

name: Heath Ceramics
summary: Iconic California company designing and making handcrafted ceramic dinnerware and architectural tile.
verdict: A true American craft story, all Heath Ceramics products are made by skilled artisans in their Sausalito, California factory.

name: Rickshaw Bagworks
summary: Creates custom messenger bags, backpacks, and accessories with a focus on sustainability.
verdict: Every Rickshaw bag is designed and manufactured in their own factory in the Dogpatch neighborhood of San Francisco.

name: Danner Boots
summary: A heritage brand crafting high-quality hiking, work, and military boots since 1932.
verdict: Danner's iconic stitchdown boots are handcrafted in its Portland, Oregon factory, though it is owned by a Japanese parent company.

name: Pendleton Woolen Mills
summary: An iconic American brand weaving world-class wool blankets, apparel, and home furnishings.
verdict: A family-owned company for over 150 years, Pendleton continues to weave its legendary fabrics in its Pacific Northwest mills.

name: Feathered Friends
summary: A legendary Seattle company making premium down sleeping bags, jackets, and expedition gear.
verdict: For over 50 years, every Feathered Friends product has been designed and manufactured in their Seattle, Washington factory.

name: Duckworth
summary: The world's only source-verified, single-origin merino wool apparel company.
verdict: A completely American supply chain, the merino wool is grown on their ranch in Montana and the garments are sewn in the USA.

name: Maglite
summary: Iconic manufacturer of high-quality, durable flashlights used by professionals and consumers.
verdict: Every Maglite flashlight is designed and manufactured at their factory in Ontario, California.

name: SureFire
summary: A leading manufacturer of high-end tactical flashlights, weapon-mounted lights, and suppressors.
verdict: SureFire products are proudly designed and manufactured in the USA at their Fountain Valley, California facility.

name: The North Face (Backpacks)
summary: A dominant global brand for outdoor apparel and equipment.
verdict: While the vast majority of its products are made overseas, The North Face's 'Backbone' collection of classic backpacks are assembled in the USA.

name: Kershaw Knives
summary: A popular brand of sporting and pocket knives known for its innovative designs.
verdict: While owned by the Japanese KAI Group, Kershaw proudly produces a large number of its knives in its Tualatin, Oregon facility.

name: Gerber Gear
summary: An American brand that produces knives, multi-tools, and other outdoor equipment.
verdict: While owned by the Finnish company Fiskars, Gerber continues to manufacture a significant portion of its products in its Portland, Oregon factory.

name: Cascade Designs
summary: Parent company of iconic outdoor brands like MSR, Therm-a-Rest, and Platypus.
verdict: A commitment to quality and local manufacturing means many of their products are still made in their facilities in Seattle, WA and Reno, NV.

name: Beyond Clothing
summary: Manufactures technical survival clothing systems for professionals and outdoor enthusiasts.
verdict: Beyond's primary clothing lines are proudly designed, tested, and manufactured in Seattle, Washington.

name: Crescent Down Works
summary: A small company creating high-quality, made-to-order down jackets and vests.
verdict: Every piece is still custom made in their factory in Seattle, Washington, as it has been since 1974.

name: Stasher
summary: Creator of reusable platinum silicone storage bags as an alternative to single-use plastics.
verdict: A certified B-Corp, Stasher bags are designed in California and proudly made in the USA.

name: Klean Kanteen
summary: A family-owned company that introduced the first stainless steel, BPA-free reusable water bottle.
verdict: A certified B-Corp based in Chico, CA, with a commitment to ethical and environmentally conscious global manufacturing.

name: Hydro Flask
summary: A leading brand of insulated water bottles, tumblers, and food flasks.
verdict: Designed in Bend, Oregon, Hydro Flask products are manufactured in China. The parent company is Helen of Troy Limited.

name: Exotac
summary: Designs and manufactures high-quality, waterproof fire starters and survival gear.
verdict: All Exotac products are designed and manufactured in the USA, primarily in Georgia.

name: MelroseCo
summary: A beauty and lifestyle brand creating a range of products from apparel to candles.
verdict: All MelroseCo products are proudly made in small batches in the USA.

name: Bismarck Mandan CVB
summary: Promotional body for local goods, including many food producers in the region.
verdict: Represents numerous small-batch food artisans and producers making products in North Dakota.

name: Dakota Layers
summary: A cooperative of family farms producing and packaging fresh eggs.
verdict: All eggs are sourced from local farms and processed in their facility in Flandreau, South Dakota.

name: Prairie Berry Winery
summary: An award-winning winery producing a wide variety of wines from local fruits.
verdict: All wines are crafted and bottled at their winery in the Black Hills of South Dakota.

name: Montana Mex
summary: Creates a line of clean-label sauces and seasonings, including ketchup and avocado oil.
verdict: All products are developed and made in the USA, with headquarters in Bozeman, Montana.

name: Melvin Brewing
summary: An award-winning craft brewery known for its hoppy IPAs and creative beers.
verdict: Melvin Brewing crafts all of its beers at their facility in Alpine, Wyoming.

name: Dorothy Lynch Home Style Dressing
summary: A famous, unique salad dressing with a sweet and spicy flavor, a Nebraska staple.
verdict: This iconic dressing has been made in its hometown of Columbus, Nebraska for over 50 years.

name: Poppytalk
summary: Producer of gourmet, small-batch popcorn with a variety of unique flavors.
verdict: All popcorn is grown in Nebraska and handcrafted in their facility in Omaha.

name: Vortex Optics
summary: A leading brand in high-performance optics for hunting, shooting, and wildlife observation.
verdict: While most components are sourced globally, their high-end Razor HD AMG rifle scopes are proudly assembled in their Wisconsin facility.

name: Head Country Bar-B-Q
summary: A top-selling barbecue sauce brand known for its well-balanced, classic flavor.
verdict: All Head Country sauces, marinades, and seasonings are made in Ponca City, Oklahoma.

name: Braum's
summary: A family-owned chain of ice cream parlors and grocery stores with its own dairy farm.
verdict: A model of vertical integration, Braum's processes its own milk and makes its own ice cream at their facility in Tuttle, Oklahoma.

name: Propper
summary: A leading supplier of apparel for military, law enforcement, and public safety.
verdict: Propper maintains a significant manufacturing presence in the USA, with 'Made in USA' collections being a core part of their offering.

name: Volpi Foods
summary: A 4th-generation family business crafting artisanal, slow-cured meats like salami and prosciutto.
verdict: All Volpi cured meats are handcrafted and sliced in their facilities in St. Louis, Missouri.

name: Rose Bud Foulks
summary: Producer of classic Arkansas meat products, including sausages and their famous 'souse'.
verdict: A local institution, all products are made at their facility in Rose Bud, Arkansas.

name: Grapette
summary: A classic grape-flavored soda that originated in Arkansas in the 1930s.
verdict: After disappearing for years, the Grapette brand is back and produced under license by Walmart, made in the USA.

name: Zapp's Potato Chips
summary: Kettle-cooked potato chips with unique, bold Louisiana flavors like Voodoo and Spicy Cajun Crawtator.
verdict: Zapp's chips are cooked in their factory in Gramercy, Louisiana, though the brand is owned by Utz.

name: Community Coffee
summary: The largest family-owned retail coffee brand in America, a Louisiana staple.
verdict: All Community Coffee is roasted and packaged at their facilities in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

name: Abita Brewing Company
summary: One of the oldest craft breweries in the Southeast, known for its Purple Haze and Amber Lager.
verdict: All Abita beers are brewed using water from their artesian wells at the brewery in Abita Springs, Louisiana.

name: Tony's Seafood
summary: The largest seafood market in the Gulf South, also shipping a variety of Cajun food products.
verdict: A Baton Rouge landmark, Tony's prepares and ships its authentic Louisiana seafood products from its local facility.

name: Duck Commander
summary: Company famous for its high-quality duck calls and hunting gear, featured on the show Duck Dynasty.
verdict: All Duck Commander duck calls are proudly made and tuned by hand in West Monroe, Louisiana.

name: WeatherTech
summary: A leading manufacturer of high-quality automotive accessories, including floor mats and cargo liners.
verdict: WeatherTech is a strong advocate for American manufacturing, with the vast majority of its products made in its factories in Illinois.

name: Faribault Foods
summary: A leading food processing company producing canned goods like beans, chili, and vegetables.
verdict: Faribault Foods has been producing canned goods in the Midwest for over a century, with its main plant in Faribault, Minnesota.

name: HammerHead Moles
summary: Manufacturer of piercing tools and other solutions for the underground construction industry.
verdict: A global brand owned by The Toro Company, HammerHead manufactures its products in Lake Mills, Wisconsin.

name: Carmex
summary: A famous brand of lip balm known for its medicated formula in a distinctive yellow-capped jar.
verdict: Carmex is a family-owned company, and its products are manufactured at its facility in Franklin, Wisconsin.

name: Bison Coolers
summary: A family-owned business making heavy-duty, high-performance coolers and drinkware.
verdict: All Bison hard coolers are proudly made in the United States, with a focus on durability and quality.

name: Stetson
summary: The iconic American brand that created the 'Boss of the Plains' cowboy hat.
verdict: Stetson hats continue to be manufactured in their factory in Garland, Texas, upholding a legacy of American Western wear.

name: Frye Boots (Arkansas)
summary: The oldest continuously operated shoe company in the US, known for its iconic boots.
verdict: While many Frye products are imported, the brand still operates a manufacturing facility in Wynne, Arkansas for its 'Made in USA' collection.

name: Grown As* Cereal
summary: Creates healthy, organic, and plant-based cereals for adults.
verdict: All cereals are produced and packaged in the USA, with headquarters in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

name: Martin Guitar
summary: A legendary maker of acoustic guitars, prized by musicians worldwide.
verdict: C. F. Martin & Company has been handcrafting world-renowned guitars in Nazareth, Pennsylvania since 1833.

name: Mack Trucks
summary: An iconic American truck manufacturer known for its heavy-duty vehicles.
verdict: While owned by the Swedish Volvo Group, all Mack trucks built for the North American market are assembled at their plant in Macungie, Pennsylvania.

name: Harley-Davidson (York)
summary: The legendary American motorcycle manufacturer's primary assembly plant.
verdict: This facility in York, Pennsylvania is the main assembly plant for Harley-Davidson's iconic motorcycles.

name: Yuengling
summary: America's Oldest Brewery, family-owned and operated since 1829.
verdict: Yuengling beer is brewed at its historic facilities in Pottsville, Pennsylvania.

name: Utz Quality Foods
summary: A major American snack food company famous for its potato chips and pretzels.
verdict: Utz continues to produce its snacks at its primary facilities in Hanover, Pennsylvania.

name: Hershey's
summary: One of the largest and most famous chocolate manufacturers in the world.
verdict: The iconic Hershey's chocolate bars and Kisses are made in Hershey, Pennsylvania.

name: Peeps
summary: The famous marshmallow candies, especially popular around Easter.
verdict: Peeps are made by the Just Born company at their factory in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania.

name: Snyder's of Hanover
summary: Creates ready-to-wear and custom shirts in a historic MA factory.
verdict: As America's oldest ready-to-wear shirt manufacturer, every shirt is cut and sewn in their Fall River, MA factory.

name: Campbell's Soup
summary: An iconic American company known for its canned soups and other food products.
verdict: Campbell's Soup is headquartered and maintains a significant production presence in Camden, New Jersey.

name: Dr. Scholl's (Insoles)
summary: A well-known brand for foot care products, especially insoles and orthotics.
verdict: Many of Dr. Scholl's insoles are manufactured at their facility in Cleveland, Tennessee.

name: Corle + Hand
summary: A small workshop creating heirloom-quality leather goods like wallets, belts, and bags.
verdict: All items are cut, stitched, and finished by hand in their studio in Richmond, Virginia.

name: Hubbard Peanut Company
summary: Creators of 'Hubs' peanuts, a Virginia classic known for their unique crunchy texture.
verdict: Hubs peanuts are cooked and packaged by the Hubbard family in Sedley, Virginia.

name: Homer Laughlin China
summary: The parent company of Fiesta Tableware and a major producer of commercial dinnerware.
verdict: A cornerstone of the American pottery industry, all dinnerware is produced in Newell, West Virginia.

name: Blenko Glass Company
summary: A family-owned company known for its colorful, hand-blown glass art and tableware.
verdict: Blenko Glass has been handcrafting its iconic glassware in Milton, West Virginia, since 1921.

name: J.Q. Dickinson Salt-Works
summary: A 7th-generation family business harvesting finishing salt from an ancient ocean trapped below the Appalachian Mountains.
verdict: The salt is harvested and processed by hand on their family farm in Malden, West Virginia.

name: Four Roses Bourbon
summary: A historic Kentucky bourbon brand known for its unique recipes and smooth flavor.
verdict: All Four Roses bourbon is distilled and aged in Kentucky, though the parent company is Japan-based Kirin Brewery Company.

name: Big Green Egg
summary: The world's largest producer and international distributor of Kamado-style ceramic grills.
verdict: A US-owned company headquartered in Georgia, their ceramic components are manufactured in Mexico.

name: Grado Labs
summary: A family-run business that hand-builds world-renowned headphones and phono cartridges.
verdict: Grado has been hand-building its products in the same Brooklyn brownstone for over 60 years.

name: Hanky Panky
summary: A popular brand of women's lingerie, famous for its comfortable and colorful lace thongs.
verdict: Hanky Panky is proudly designed and produced in the New York City area, using US-made components where possible.

name: MacKenzie-Childs
summary: Creates vibrant, hand-decorated ceramic tableware, furniture, and home accessories.
verdict: The signature ceramics are handcrafted by artisans at their studio on a historic farm in Aurora, New York.

name: Gorham Silver
summary: One of the largest American manufacturers of sterling and silverplate flatware and holloware.
verdict: A historic Rhode Island brand, Gorham continues its legacy of American silver craftsmanship.

name: Doggone Good
summary: Creates specialty gear and apparel for dog training and canine sports.
verdict: All products are designed and manufactured in the USA, with headquarters in Fredericksburg, Virginia.

name: Marble King
summary: One of the last remaining American manufacturers of toy marbles.
verdict: Marble King has been producing billions of marbles in West Virginia since 1949.

name: Dogfish Head
summary: A pioneering craft brewery known for its off-centered and experimental beers.
verdict: While now part of the Boston Beer Company (which has foreign ownership stakes), Dogfish Head's beer and spirits are brewed and distilled in Milton, Delaware.

name: Iglidur
summary: Manufactures high-performance plastic bearings and components for a variety of industries.
verdict: While a German-owned company, Igus Inc. operates a large manufacturing facility in Rumford, Rhode Island.

name: Chaco
summary: Maker of the iconic sport sandals with adjustable straps, popular for outdoor and water activities.
verdict: While most sandals are imported, Chaco runs the ReChaco program in Rockford, Michigan, to repair and customize sandals with American labor.

name: Kingston
summary: A leading independent manufacturer of memory products, including RAM and SSDs.
verdict: Kingston Technology assembles a significant portion of its memory modules at its headquarters in Fountain Valley, California.

name: Mag Instrument
summary: The iconic manufacturer of durable, high-quality Maglite flashlights.
verdict: Every Maglite flashlight is designed and manufactured at their factory in Ontario, California.

name: Scosche Industries
summary: Designs and manufactures a wide range of consumer tech, from phone mounts to audio accessories.
verdict: A family-owned company based in California, with design and engineering in the US and manufacturing overseas.

name: The Original Muck Boot Company
summary: A leading brand for comfortable, waterproof rubber boots for work and outdoor activities.
verdict: While an American heritage brand, it is now owned by a UK-based company and manufactures its boots primarily in Asia.

name: Outdoor Research
summary: A trusted brand for technical outdoor apparel and gear, especially for alpinism.
verdict: Outdoor Research operates its own factory in Seattle, Washington, producing a dedicated line of 'Made in USA' products.

name: Boyd's Coffee
summary: One of the oldest family-owned coffee companies in the Pacific Northwest.
verdict: All Boyd's coffee is roasted at their facility in Portland, Oregon, continuing a tradition since 1900.

name: DeMarini Sports
summary: A leading manufacturer of high-performance baseball and softball bats.
verdict: While owned by Wilson Sporting Goods (a Finnish company), DeMarini's high-end bats are designed and assembled in Hillsboro, Oregon.

name: Klim
summary: A global leader in designing and manufacturing advanced technical riding gear for motorsports.
verdict: Klim is a US-owned company based in Idaho, with its products designed and tested in the Rocky Mountains and manufactured globally.

name: Proof Eyewear
summary: A family-owned company making handcrafted eyewear from sustainable materials like wood and recycled aluminum.
verdict: Proof's premium wood and custom eyewear lines are handcrafted in their workshop in Boise, Idaho.

name: Purple Mattress
summary: An innovative mattress company known for its unique 'Purple Grid' technology.
verdict: All Purple mattresses are designed and manufactured in their facilities in Utah.

name: Stance
summary: A popular brand creating artistic and performance-driven socks, underwear, and t-shirts.
verdict: Stance is a US-owned company based in California, with manufacturing primarily located in Asia.

name: TRUCK Gloves
summary: Designs high-quality, affordable gloves for skiing, snowboarding, and other outdoor sports.
verdict: A US-based company with design and testing in the Lake Tahoe area and manufacturing overseas.

name: Scheels
summary: A major sporting goods and outdoor retailer with massive stores across the Midwest and West.
verdict: Scheels is a US-owned company headquartered in Fargo, North Dakota. Most of its branded products are globally sourced.

name: Dakota Angler
summary: A specialty fly fishing shop that also produces its own line of hand-tied flies.
verdict: Their custom flies are tied by local experts in Rapid City, South Dakota, catering to the Black Hills region.

name: Alps OutdoorZ
summary: Provides high-quality hunting packs and gear designed for performance and durability.
verdict: A US-owned company, Alps products are designed in Missouri and manufactured globally.

name: Traeger Grills
summary: The original inventor of the wood-pellet grill, a leader in outdoor cooking.
verdict: Traeger is a US-owned company based in Salt Lake City, with its grills manufactured in China.

name: Vitamix
summary: A leading manufacturer of high-performance blenders for home and commercial use.
verdict: Vitamix is a family-owned company and proudly manufactures its products at its headquarters in Olmsted Township, Ohio.

name: Work Sharp
summary: Creates innovative and easy-to-use knife and tool sharpeners.
verdict: Work Sharp sharpeners are designed, engineered, and assembled in Ashland, Oregon.

name: Able Brewing Equipment
summary: Designs and manufactures innovative coffee brewing equipment, including reusable metal filters.
verdict: All Able Brewing products are proudly manufactured in the United States.

name: Showers Pass
summary: Specializes in high-performance waterproof and breathable outerwear for cycling and running.
verdict: Based in Portland, Oregon, Showers Pass designs its gear for the Pacific Northwest weather, with manufacturing done overseas.

name: CamelBak
summary: The inventor of hands-free hydration packs, a leader in hydration systems.
verdict: While owned by Vista Outdoor, CamelBak's bottles are designed in California and many are assembled in the USA from global components.

name: GSI Outdoors
summary: A family-owned company producing a wide range of innovative cookware and accessories for outdoor camping.
verdict: GSI Outdoors is a US-owned company based in Washington state, with products manufactured overseas.

name: Chrome Industries
summary: Known for its iconic messenger bags with a seatbelt buckle, and durable cycling apparel.
verdict: While owned by a Japanese company, Chrome Industries still proudly manufactures its custom bags in its own factory in Chico, California.

name: Seek Outside
summary: Manufactures lightweight, high-performance tents, tipis, and wood stoves for backcountry hunting and camping.
verdict: All Seek Outside products are designed and manufactured in Grand Junction, Colorado.

name: Kialoa Paddles
summary: Designs and manufactures high-performance paddles for stand-up paddleboarding, outrigger, and dragon boat.
verdict: Kialoa has been handcrafting its paddles in the USA for over 30 years, with its factory in Bend, Oregon.

name: Enlightened Equipment
summary: Specializes in ultralight, customizable quilts and sleeping bags for backpacking.
verdict: Every quilt is handcrafted in their workshop in Winona, Minnesota, a favorite among thru-hikers.

name: Bison Booties
summary: Handcrafts soft-soled leather shoes and booties for babies and toddlers.
verdict: All booties are handmade in a small workshop in Bismarck, North Dakota.

name: Pride of Dakota
summary: A program promoting a wide array of products made by local artisans and companies.
verdict: Represents hundreds of North Dakota makers, ensuring products are genuinely local.

name: Dakotah Inc
summary: Designs and manufactures custom and ready-made bedding and window treatments.
verdict: A long-standing American textile company, products are made in Webster, South Dakota.

name: Tanka Bar
summary: Based on a traditional Lakota recipe, these bars are made from buffalo meat and cranberries.
verdict: Tanka Bar is a Native American-owned company based on the Pine Ridge Reservation, supporting local communities.

name: Montana Watch Company
summary: Creates handcrafted, custom mechanical watches inspired by the American West.
verdict: Each watch is designed and hand-assembled by master watchmakers in Livingston, Montana.

name: Mountain Meadow Wool Mill
summary: A family-owned mill producing high-quality yarn, apparel, and home goods from Wyoming wool.
verdict: Mountain Meadow is a full-service mill, processing raw wool into finished goods in Buffalo, Wyoming.

name: Maven Outdoor Equipment
summary: Builds high-performance, direct-to-consumer binoculars, spotting scopes, and rifle scopes.
verdict: Maven's high-end 'B Series' binoculars are assembled in Lander, Wyoming, offering a USA-made option for optics.

name: Bulldoggers
summary: Handcrafts custom leather sandals and belts.
verdict: Every item is handmade to order in their workshop in rural Nebraska.

name: Heartland Mill
summary: Mills certified organic flours and grains sourced from local and regional farms.
verdict: Heartland Mill provides high-quality, organic flour milled at their facility in Marienthal, Kansas.

name: Yoder Smokers
summary: Builds high-quality, heavy-duty BBQ smokers and pellet grills for competition and backyard use.
verdict: All Yoder Smokers are handcrafted by skilled fabricators in their facility near Hutchinson, Kansas.

name: Shawnee Milling Company
summary: A family-owned company making flour, cornmeal, and baking mixes for over 100 years.
verdict: Shawnee Milling Company continues its tradition of milling quality products in Shawnee, Oklahoma.

name: The Pasta House Co.
summary: A famous St. Louis restaurant brand that also sells its signature pasta sauces and salad dressings.
verdict: The sauces and dressings that define St. Louis Italian-American cuisine are made in St. Louis, Missouri.

name: The Roasterie
summary: A specialty coffee roaster known for its air-roasting method and iconic DC-3 aircraft logo.
verdict: All coffee is roasted at their factory in Kansas City, Missouri.

name: Daisy Outdoor Products
summary: The iconic American brand famous for its Red Ryder BB gun and other youth air rifles.
verdict: Daisy has been producing its classic airguns for over 130 years and continues to manufacture them in Rogers, Arkansas.

name: War Eagle Boats
summary: Builds high-quality, all-welded aluminum boats for fishing and hunting.
verdict: All War Eagle boats are manufactured at their facility in Monticello, Arkansas.

name: Savage Arms
summary: A leading manufacturer of rifles and shotguns, known for accuracy and innovation.
verdict: Savage Arms manufactures its firearms at its factory in Westfield, Massachusetts.

name: Slumberkins
summary: Creates emotional learning resources for children, featuring cuddly creatures and books.
verdict: A US-based company, their products are designed in Washington state and manufactured overseas.

name: Filson (ID)
summary: A heritage brand producing rugged, high-quality outerwear, bags, and luggage.
verdict: In addition to their Seattle factory, Filson operates a manufacturing facility in Post Falls, Idaho.

name: Blueridge Chair Works
summary: Crafts innovative and portable outdoor furniture, like their famous two-piece camp chairs.
verdict: All furniture is handcrafted in Western North Carolina, designed for comfort and durability.

name: Lawn-Boy
summary: A well-known brand of lawn mowers, now part of The Toro Company.
verdict: Lawn-Boy mowers are assembled in US facilities, including in Mississippi, but contain global components.

name: Vera Bradley
summary: Famous for its colorful and quilted cotton bags, luggage, and accessories.
verdict: A US-based company, the majority of Vera Bradley's products are manufactured overseas.

name: Chaco (MI)
summary: Maker of the iconic sport sandals, offering repairs and customization in the US.
verdict: The ReChaco program in Rockford, Michigan, allows for US-based repairs and customizations of their sandals.

name: American Expedition Vehicles
summary: A premier manufacturer of high-quality aftermarket parts and vehicle conversions for Jeeps and RAM trucks.
verdict: AEV engineers and manufactures its components in Michigan and Montana, with vehicle conversions done in-house.

name: Shinola
summary: A luxury goods retailer known for its watches, leather goods, and bicycles.
verdict: Shinola products are designed and assembled in Detroit, utilizing both domestic and imported components.

name: Best Chairs Storytime Series
summary: A family-owned furniture company specializing in gliders, recliners, and nursery seating.
verdict: All Best Chairs products are manufactured in their facilities in Ferdinand, Indiana.

name: Wood-Mizer
summary: A leading manufacturer of portable sawmills and wood processing equipment.
verdict: Wood-Mizer manufactures its equipment for the North American market at its headquarters in Indianapolis, Indiana.

name: J.A. Henckels International
summary: A major brand of knives and cookware, part of the German Zwilling group.
verdict: While a German company, some Henckels International cutlery lines are manufactured in their factory in Pleasantville, New York.
